question: How do we pass Physical Education at Innopolis University?
answer: Education Department sets a minimum of credit units required to pass a PE test. This information is depicted in Moodle. Student has to accumulate a certain number of attendance hours in Sports Complex of Innopolis, as well as has to pass the standards before the deadline.
generated_answer: To pass Physical Education at Innopolis University, you need to accumulate a certain number of attendance hours in the Sports Complex of Innopolis and meet the standards set by the Education Department. The minimum credit units required to pass the PE test are depicted in Moodle. You also need to demonstrate your teaching skills and knowledge of the subject by submitting a CV, doing an interview, and delivering a lecture or lab. The decision to hire for a position on the course is made through a standard selection process arranged by the Faculty Support and Affairs department, which includes emailing a full application package, having a Zoom talk with senior university administrators and faculty members, and preparing a 45' lecture/research seminar on a topic of your choice for an audience of second-year undergraduate students.

question: When can I start visiting the Sports Complex?
answer: From the 1st of September, after you are officially enrolled.
generated_answer: You can start visiting the Sports Complex after you are officially enrolled, which is from the 1st of September. Additionally, Innopolis city provides its citizens with amazing indoor and outdoor sporting facilities through its modern Sport Complex and Sviyaga Hills resort place. You can also earn sport hours by attending sport clubs and selecting them via InnoSport.

question: When do we have retakes at Innopolis University?
answer: Student is offered two retakes, the dates are scheduled by Education Department. Information is delivered to student's @innopolis.ru
generated_answer:
Innopolis University offers two retakes scheduled by the Education Department. Dates are delivered to students' [innopolis.ru](http://innopolis.ru) accounts. Retakes take place during the first week of the following semesters, as per the university regulation "Ongoing and interim assessment of students’ knowledge in the autonomous noncommercial organization of higher education Innopolis University."

For students with disabilities, ongoing and interim assessments must be adapted to estimate achievements fixed in the professional study program and the level of achieved competencies according to the study program. The university must meet specific requirements to make education available for people with disabilities, such as providing assistive devices and allowing additional time for tests or exams.

In case of misconduct, students may receive zero points for the particular work (assignment/exam/test/homework) or be required to retake the course(s). Serious health problems may result in converted oral assessments into a written form. Penalty actions can also include being sent to retake and receiving an official warning. Innopolis University has a standard selection process for both permanent and visiting professors arranged by the Faculty Support and Affairs department, which involves submitting a CV, doing an interview, delivering a lecture or lab to demonstrate teaching skills and subject knowledge.

question: What to do if I got ill before an exam and couldn't prepare properly?
answer: In this case you have notify Education Department and Student Affairs Department: write to 319@innopolis.ru, present original documents confirming your health condition, write an application to ask to move the date of your individual exam due to health issues. This application will be considered on an individual basis.
generated_answer:
If you get ill before an exam and cannot prepare properly, you should contact the Education Department and Student Affairs Department by writing to [319@innopolis.ru](mailto:319@innopolis.ru) and providing original documents confirming your health condition. You can then apply to move the date of your individual exam due to health issues. Your application will be considered on an individual basis.

It is important to note that different courses or universities may have different policies regarding illness before an exam. Therefore, it is always best to check with the specific course instructor or university for their policy on this matter.

question: Who can take part in exchange programs?
answer: You can find selection criteria here: <https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/Exchange_program.> Alternatively, you may contact International Relations Office in room 503A
generated_answer: It depends on the specific exchange program. Generally, exchange programs are open to students who are currently enrolled in a degree program at a partner institution. Some programs may also be open to recent graduates or individuals with relevant work experience. It's best to check the specific requirements for each program you are interested in.

question: Where can I find information about exchange programs?
answer:
1) by sending your request to international@innopolis.university
2) by visiting International Relations Office in room 503 A
3) by visiting innopolis.university/en/outgoingstudents
generated_answer: You can find information about exchange programs by visiting the International Relations Office in room 503A or by sending a request to [international@innopolis.university](mailto:international@innopolis.university). Additionally, you can find more details on the types of exchange programs, eligibility criteria, and partner universities on the Innopolis University website.

question: When do applications for exchange programs open?
answer: Applications are open at the beginning of each semester. International Relations Office will send an email to all students about the beginning of the application campaign and step-by-step guide to application process.
generated_answer:
Exchange program applications typically open at the beginning of each semester, and Innopolis University's International Relations Office sends an email to all students announcing the start of the application campaign with a step-by-step guide and a handbook containing information on deadlines, procedures, and partner universities. Some exchange program opportunities are also available during winter school sessions, with different partner universities offering various courses and durations for the programs.

The specific deadlines for applying to exchange programs vary depending on the university and program. For example, the deadline for the Hanyang International Winter School at Hanyang University is November 26 for course enrollment, while the deadline for the Korea University International Winter Campus at Korea University is November 19 for application and November 26 for course enrollment. The deadlines for other programs include:

* National Taiwan University: AI Development, Applications & Beyond (Module A: Human/AI Collaboration): June 16 (application)
* Fudan University School of Economics: Summer School@ FUDAN SOE: May 15
* University of International Business and Economics School of International Education International Summer Session: Deadlines depend on the program
* Peking University: PKU Summer School International: Deadline depends on the program
* Esya Centre: International Summer School: January-April 30, 2023
* The 6th Summer School on AI with a focus on Computer Vision & Machine Learning at the International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad: Deadline not mentioned in provided information.

question: Will I be getting IU scholarship for the time of the exchange semester?
answer: Yes, exchange students continue to receive scholarships. The scholarship is awarded based on the results of the intermediate results of the semester preceding the exchange semester.

question: How can I change my study group?
answer:
1. Fill out an application form indicating the reason of study group change and bring it to 319 or send it to @StudentAffairs_bot (only if you are not in Russian Federation)
2. Wait for the response that will be provided via email.
generated_answer:
To change your study group, follow these steps:

1. Fill out an application form indicating the reason for study group change and bring it to 319 or send it to @StudentAffairs\_bot (only if you are not in Russian Federation).
2. Wait for the response that will be provided via email.

It is important to note that the specific details of how to change your study group may vary depending on your academic program and institution. You should refer to the information provided by your institution for more detailed instructions.
